body: Thanks. Just as a suggestion you might want to update the text of the PRs you generate to indicate you are a person because it really reads like it's an automated bot and we don't have guidelines around contributions from bots but we do appreciate the contribution. I have written OPENNLP-1299 to track this change.

Worked for me using this config so I'm +1.

Apache Maven 3.6.0
Maven home: /usr/share/maven
Java version: 11.0.6, vendor: Ubuntu, runtime: /usr/lib/jvm/java-11-openjdk-amd64
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8
OS name: "linux", version: "5.3.0-40-generic", arch: "amd64", family: "unix"
The PR was automatically generated. But there is a person behind the account that did the generation. So, it is a mix of both.
Is this PR still needed? #354 that was also related to \n build problems was merged. I can get a Windows VM but just in case someone knows offhand.

Hi, this is my first time contributing to an open source project. Currently taking baby steps to see how things work. I just added missing tags for documentation. Any feedback will be much appreciated.
@jzonthemtn Thank you so much for replying! I've made the changes you suggested. Let me know if you have more feedback. Feel free to suggest a task that seems suitable for a newbie.

I tested with recent versions of Java 8 and Java 11. Both failed to build without the fix, the fix then resolved it also for both versions.

We should merge this.

Hey everyone, I noticed that 2 people have approved my changes but it didn't get merged to the master branch. I was wondering if there are further changes or steps required for my changes to get merged. Thank you for the support!

Thank you @jzonthemtn  for merging! I would love to dive deeper in this project. Does anyone recommend any tasks that are doable for a newbie or should I try solving trivial issues posted on Apache OpenNLP JIRA? Thanks for the support!

@jongwoojeff I know documentation work is not fun at all but it is a good way to learn more about a project like OpenNLP. I know we are missing a lot of Javadocs in places. There are probably places to improve the [manual](https://opennlp.apache.org/docs/1.9.2/manual/opennlp.html), too. 

There are a few tasks listed for wanting contributions at https://opennlp.apache.org/get-involved.html.

And if you haven't already, be sure to join the user and dev mailing lists at https://opennlp.apache.org/mailing-lists.html. When we do a new release it would be helpful if you could help us test it and vote for the release.

Thanks again for your contribution!
@jzonthemtn Thanks for the advice! I'll continue working on documentation for now (can't disagree that it is a great way to learn) and join the user and dev mailing lists. Thanks for the support!
This also fixed [OPENNLP-1113](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1113).
@MikalaiD Thanks for the contribution!

Hi @Alanscut , thanks for the pull request! I didn't see a JIRA ticket for this change. Do you mind making one? We use the issues to track the changes for each version for the release notes and for progress reporting. Thanks!

https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/OPENNLP/issues/
Hi @jzonthemtn , JIRA ticket has been created: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1310
Successfully built and tests pass.

Thanks a lot for this contribution! This is something OpenNLP has needed. I will take a closer look.

Maven home: /opt/apache-maven
Java version: 11.0.9.1, vendor: Ubuntu, runtime: /usr/lib/jvm/java-11-openjdk-amd64
Default locale: en_US, platform encoding: UTF-8

Thanks for the pull request!

I think it's OK to merge this without adding a test. I couldn't find a location in the existing tests files that would be a good spot to add this. I'd love to dig in and figure out how to make a test case for this fit within an existing test file or create a new test. But that's a tall order (for me, given my newness to the codebase). 

It would add significant delay for a small change that can be confidently reasoned about. The risk, in this case, is not that a code-related bug is introduced. The risk is that a reason/understanding-based bug is introduced. A test wouldn't fix faulty reasoning.

As for the reason this is `first` rather than `last`, https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/TreeSet.html.

```
A NavigableSet implementation based on a TreeMap. 
The elements are ordered using their natural ordering, 
or by a Comparator provided at set creation time, 
depending on which constructor is used. 
```

`completeParses` is defined as a TreeSet on line 187:

```
completeParses = new TreeSet<>();
```

And `Parse`s that are added to `completeParses` have a compareTo so they are ordered by their log probability.

```
  public int compareTo(Parse p) {
    return Double.compare(p.getProb(), this.getProb());
  }
```
I wrote OPENNLP-1333 to capture the need for a unit test. Thanks again @eihli.
We can further improve the testing logic by creating mock object inside of the test case and only stub `find(String[])` method.
@jsteggink Thanks a lot for the pull request!
You are welcome!

Please consider https://github.com/apache/opennlp/pull/399 instead. The URL regex shouldn't cause super-linear complexity like the MAIL regex does, I believe. The problem is that the regex is used in `String.replaceAll(...)`, and is evaluated for each suffix of bad input—this does not happen for the URL regex, which can only be a few characters long before it either fails or succeeds definitively.
Hi @jonmv, thanks for the contribution! Are there any test changes needed or is it only a performance improvement?
There are some checkstyle issues I will be fixing.
@kinow I missed that pom file! I fixed it in the last push and added a few more unit tests.

Hi, the unit tests do not need to be updated. They were valid before, and still are. This is primarily a performance optimisation. Additionally, the PR allows `+` in the local-part of emails, and disallows `_` in the domain part. This is just an improvement. The actual email local-part rules are terrifying, and probably not worth expressing in a regex—the current is a compromise which should capture common email addresses out there.

> Hi, the unit tests do not need to be updated. They were valid before, and still are.

:+1: 

>This is primarily a performance optimisation. Additionally, the PR allows `+` in the local-part of emails, and disallows `_` in the domain part. This is just an improvement.

I think this is a good improvement, I use `+` a lot for $work and also for myself. I think we should add a unit test for these two improvements, just to make sure that this is not reverted accidentally later. WDYT?

> The actual email local-part rules are terrifying, and probably not worth expressing in a regex—the current is a compromise which should capture common email addresses out there.

:+1: and I think the lookbehind and performance should be fine, no need for any benchmark IMO. I'll go through your comment above (thanks!) just to educate myself :neckbeard: 

Thank you!
-Bruno

> I think we should add a unit test for these two improvements, just to make sure that this is not reverted accidentally later. WDYT?

Yes, you're right.
Sorry about that, a little edit error in the expected outcome.
Got it, let me review the JIRA issue fields to see if it needs updating, and squash the commits. Then if CI passes I think we are ready to merge it. Thanks @jonmv !
Squashed commits into a single commit, then re-worded single commit to have the prefix OPENNLP-1350. Finally, rebased, then push-force'd :+1:
Great, thanks :)

Closed/opened but Travis CI bot didn't come here to comment. The build is in progress though: https://app.travis-ci.com/github/apache/opennlp/builds/244439208

JIRA is up to date, will come back later to see if Travis is done, then merge it if no issues found.
Thanks @jonmv and @kinow!

This is now ready for review. To review, one can look at the latest build on my fork where the action has already run: https://github.com/kinow/opennlp/actions/runs/1686590266

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/304786/149090969-8677452e-cb75-4e41-806a-9b1017f8d809.png)

Note that the coverage is failing, but not failing the build. This is the exact same behaviour from master. To confirm, you can open a recent pull request (like the ONNX one), then go to checks, expand and click. There, find the link to the build, and look at the raw logs.

It will contain something similar to this screenshot:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/304786/149091150-a62bed26-00b6-4221-9b9c-78116a7556ab.png)

The time to start and complete the build was **a lot** faster than Travis CI recent builds :+1: 

Cheers,
Bruno
Thanks @jzonthemtn !

You're welcome!

This is a pull request from a community submitted patch file on [OPENNLP-1306](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/OPENNLP/issues/OPENNLP-1306) to add the sentence to the name finder training error message to provide more context about the problem.

I would like to better understand the origins of the rules used. Does there need to be license attribution?
This has been here awhile but looks ready to merge. I cloned it and merged it with the current master branch and built and tested fine. @kinow do you mind giving it a look over?
This is PR #346 with merge conflicts resolved.
This branch now has merge conflicts that can't be resolved inside this PR. I have created PR #408 to include these changes and the resolved conflicts and will close this PR.
The previously referenced PR #399 was merged. Since this PR has been open for some time without updates I am going to close it. If there is a need to reopen it please feel free to do so.

I believe splitting the tags by spaces is the desired input. A task will be created to determine if the documentation needs updated. I am closing this pull request. Please comment on the [JIRA task](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1257) if needed.

I believe these issues have since been resolved for building on Windows. This branch fails the 4 BRAT tests mentioned in [OPENNLP-1358](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1358) (built from the current master), so it seems the issues targeted in this pull request have been addressed.

I am going to close this pull request and the associated [JIRA task](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1264) but please feel free to reopen the PR/task if needed.

I built and tested this branch without problems. The changes don't affect the current behavior of the tokenizers nor change the interfaces. A very long time getting to this but thanks @SchmaR for your contribution.

I looked at checkstyle 8 a bit ago and some of our rules need to be updated for compatibility with version 8.  I wrote an [issue](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1367) for that, and I'm going to close this pull request so it does not accidentally get merged.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
Fixing model check to include version 1 and version 2 models.
Hi @kumar-abhishek, thanks for the PR!
@kumar-abhishek I would like to assign the JIRA [issue](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1371) to you since you provided the fix for it. Do you have an Apache JIRA username?
Some ONNX models require different inputs. This refactor adds an `InferenceOptions` class to allow for it.
This PR adds initial support for long documents by splitting them up into sections. (The size of the splits and size of the overlap of splits can be set in the `InferenceOptions`.)

Done

FYI and for completeness: I tested the patch against the German treebank resources available from: https://universaldependencies.org/#language. 

- The resulting model files could be written and read without any problem. 
- Furthermore, I tested the treebank - mentioned in the associated JIRA issue (1366) - which requires around 1.5 to 2 TB RAM and runs in a cluster setup at KIT (https://wiki.bwhpc.de/e/Main_Page) . It just finished minutes ago and writing/reading model files works fine as well! 🎉

Thanks @rzo1! It is a big PR but I don't think that's a problem here. This change is expected to touch a lot of files.

All of the changes were either in the `pom.xml` files for dependency updates or in test source files, right?
Yes. POM and src/test only.
@jzonthemtn & @atarora Feedback welcome.

This issue (OPENNLP-936) is still relevant to many users. Is there any form of consensus - in 2022 - on how to progress with the current code base?

The comments on this PR seem fairly trivial. I have no objections to getting those comments addressed and merging this. I will go through the PR again and see if there's anything since then that should be addressed.
